courses_list.course_description: The Fundamentals of Programming with Code.org course is an entry-level class for K-1st graders. No experience is necessary for this class. Code.org is an easy-to-use platform that teaches fundamental programming concepts. Students will need internet access, paper, and a writing utensil.

Basic Scratch Part 1 (2-3) is the first part of a two-part course introducing the Scratch platform to 2nd and 3rd graders. Scratch is a popular visual block-based programming language developed by the MIT Media Lab. No experience is necessary for this class. Students need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer).

Basic Scratch Part 2 (2-3) is the second part of a two-part course introducing the Scratch platform to 2nd and 3rd graders. Students should have taken Basic Scratch Part 1 before taking this class.  Scratch is a popular visual block-based programming language developed by the MIT Media Lab. Students need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer)

S﻿cratch (4-6) is an entry-level course introducing students to the Scratch platform, a popular block-based programming language developed by the MIT Media Lab. Students do not need prior experience with programming. Students will need an internet connection and a personal device (preferably computer).

C﻿omputer-Aided Design (CAD) with Tinkercad introduces students in 3rd-8th grades to the basics of computer-aided design using Tinkercad, a simple web-based platform. Students do not need prior experience or knowledge of CAD. Students will need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer).

**Onshape will not be running over the summer. Please check in during August to see if it will be running for our fall session.**

C﻿omputer-Aided Design (CAD) with Onshape introduces students in 5th-8th grades to the basics of computer-aided design using Onshape, a cloud-based CAD platform that runs in a browser and is frequently used by industry. This curriculum teaches sketch-based modeling with an emphasis on dimensions and constraints for engineering design. Students do not need prior experience or knowledge of CAD. Students will need internet access and a personal device (preferably computer).

W﻿eb Design with HTML/CSS (6-8) introduces students in 6th-8th grades to how websites are developed. HTML provides structure to a website, and CSS provides style. Students do not need previous experience or knowledge of web development. Students will need an internet connection and a computer.

P﻿ython (6-8) introduces students to the Python coding language, which is a text-based programming language widely used by many companies. Students do not need previous experience with programming. Students will need an internet connection and a personal device (preferably computer).
